page.title: 11W.I. IN GILMORTON
page.content: Gilmorton W.I. was re-formed in 1946,having been closed during the war years.In the immediate post-war years it was a large institute but declined in numbers during the 1970s.It has,however,recently revived a little and now has 23 members. The Institute is part of the Avon group of W.Is. and of the Leicestershire and Rutland W.Is. It meets on the first Wednesday of each month except August.The meetings consist of a short business part,followed by a speaker of general interest and then social time during which refreshments are served. Following the destruction of the village hall by fire in 1984,the Institute meets in the school library or in members' homes. There is a similar but smaller and more informal Homemakers' Group.
